alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Rutherford; Smith; Sumner; Trousdale; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 11:49AM CDT until August 12 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Smith County in Middle Tennessee... Southeastern Davidson County in Middle Tennessee... Central Rutherford County in Middle Tennessee... Southern Sumner County in Middle Tennessee... Northeastern Williamson County in Middle Tennessee... Wilson County in Middle Tennessee... Southern Trousdale County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 1230 PM CDT. * At 1148 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Gallatin to near Franklin, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Franklin, Gallatin, Lebanon, Hartsville, Hendersonville, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Mount Juliet, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Lakewood, Watertown, Hermitage, Walterhill, Rural Hill, Antioch and Belinda City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 211 and 253. Interstate 65 between mile markers 64 and 81. Interstate 24 between mile markers 52 and 80. Interstate 840 between mile markers 45 and 76. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Davidson; Rutherford; Smith; Sumner; Trousdale; Williamson; Wilson
